com.misc.common.moplaf.propagator2.util

Class PropagatorFunctionManagerAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.impl.AdapterImpl
      • com.misc.common.moplaf.propagator2.util.PropagatorFunctionManagerAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.Adapter, org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.Adapter.Internal

    public class PropagatorFunctionManagerAdapter
extends org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.impl.AdapterImpl
    An adapter that maintains itself as an adapter for all contained objects as they come and go. It can be installed for an EObject, a Resource, or a ResourceSet.

    Add and remove PropagatorFunctions for ObjectWithPropagatorFunctions

    The PropagatorFunctionAdapterManager is added when the listening must begin, that is when derived elements must be maintained. This is typically just after the objects are retrieved from their persistent storage (both primitive and derived elements), so after the Resource is loaded. In the EMF generated editor, this will be in the createModel method.

    Handle the management of the PropagatorFunction, that is when they are constructed, enabled and disabled. For this, implement specific behaviors at the following moments:

    • when the Notifier is added to its container: method onNotifierContainedPre(Notifier)
      • call the constructor method PropagatorFunctionsConstructor.addPropagatorFunctions(ObjectWithPropagatorFunctions)
      • this latter may create and add PropagatorFunctions
      • the created PropagatorFunctions may be touched, if the refresh must happen at construction time
    • when the adapter is added: onAdapterAdded(Notifier)
      • enable the PropagatorFunctions: call to PropagatorFunction.enable()
      • the latter will create the dependencies: call PropagatorFunctionSource.initDependencies()
    • when the Notifier is proxy resolved: onResolve(Notifier, Notifier)
      • move the PropagatorFunctionAdapter adapters from the proxy object to the resolved object
    • when the adapter is removed: onAdapterRemoved(Notifier)
      • disable the propagator: call PropagatorFunction.disable()
      • the latter will dispose the dependencies: call to PropagatorFunctionSource.disposeDependencies()
    Internally, this Adapter listens to notifications and handles them by calling the following methods, when appropriate, but always in this sequence
    • onNotifierContainedPre(Notifier)
    • onAdapterAdded(Notifier)
    • Children are handled (Adapter added/removed)
    • onAdapterRemoved(Notifier)
    • onNotifierNotContained(Notifier)
